title: Aastha Arora: Where is India's billionth baby now?
description: The BBC revisits Aastha Arora - "the special baby" whose birth in 2000 made global headlines.

title: The Papers: 'Rishi's roar' and 'Truss legacy rejected'
description: Most of Thursday's papers look at the different issues facing Rishi Sunak as begins his new role.

title: Svalbard: The race to save the fastest-warming place on Earth
description: Svalbard, a Norwegian archipelago, is thought to be heating at six times the global average.

title: James Corden: How Jez Butterworth's 'bombshell' drama lured him back to acting
description: The star is the lead in a romantic whodunnit with more twists and turns than an Agatha Christie novel.

title: Cost of living: 'I may have to put my child in care due to bills'
description: A mum says she fears being separated from her disabled daughter due to energy costs.

title: Many skip work over hygiene poverty shame, charity says
description: Some 3.2m adults struggle to afford basic hygiene products leading to shame and exclusion, charity says.

title: Tottenham 1-1 Sporting Lisbon: Antonio Conte furious as VAR rules out late winner
description: Antonio Conte expressed his frustration as VAR denied his Tottenham side a dramatic late winner against Sporting Lisbon, before he was sent off for his reaction to the decision.

title: Sudan: 'No-one to intervene' for woman sentenced to stoning
description: A lack of government ministers in Sudan hinders attempts to prevent a woman being stoned to death.

title: Rishi Sunak urged to raise defence spending by Estonia
description: The new PM has not matched a Liz Truss target to spend 3% of national wealth on defence.

title: California's cannabis-growing nuns pray for profits
description: The income the Sisters of the Valley make from growing cannabis is at half its pre-pandemic level.

title: Champions League: Time for Antonio Conte to unleash timid Spurs with progress in balance
description: Tottenham's enforced positivity earned them a draw against Sporting Lisbon and showed why Antonio Conte should take the handbrake off, says Phil McNulty.

title: Which policies will Rishi Sunak stick with or twist?
description: We take a look at early indications of the new prime minister's direction on key areas.

title: Brazil election: Why are the poor voting for Lula?
description: Poverty is a huge election issue as many Brazilians struggle amid the cost of living crisis.

title: The impact of Iran's protests beyond its borders
description: Tensions in Iraqi Kurdistan are high after missile and drone attacks from the Iranian Revolutionary Guard.

title: Twitter: Elon Musk visits HQ as deal deadline looms
description: Elon Musk changed his Twitter bio to "Chief Twit" ahead of the Friday deadline to complete its acquisition.

title: Rescuing whales on Australia's 'humpback highway'
description: As whale populations rebound, more are getting entangled in fishing gear - and rescues are dangerous.

title: Rishi Sunak demotes Truss allies as reshuffle continues

title: Tottenham Hotspur 1-1 Sporting Lisbon: Late VAR drama denies Harry Kane winner
description: Harry Kane is denied a late winner by a lengthy VAR check as Tottenham get a Champions League draw against Sporting Lisbon that leaves them needed a point from their final group game.

description: Sam Kerr scores four as Chelsea win comfortably against Vllaznia to extend their lead at the top of their Women's Champions League group.

title: Napoli 3-0 Rangers: Fifth Champions League loss for Ibrox side but hopes remain alive
description: Rangers suffer a fifth consecutive Champions League defeat at the hands of an accomplished Napoli, but escaped without any significant damage to their brittle confidence.

title: Danny Cipriani set to return to rugby for Barbarians against Northampton

title: Asylum seekers: UK spending almost £7m a day on hotels

title: Even nuns watch porn, Pope says, warning of risks

title: Living in Downing Street: Rishi Sunak and family move back in

title: Three PMs in two months, is political chaos the UK's new normal?
